title: (x) Elephant magazine / Grotesque - H&FJ Knockout {Jan}
content:
Looking for the name of the font being used in a new magazine called elephant... the one i'm after is the large heading font. You can see it being used in the link below.

[http://www.creativereview.co.uk/cr-blog/2009/september/a-magazine-called...](http://web.archive.org/web/20121116071345/http:/www.creativereview.co.uk/cr-blog/2009/september/a-magazine-called-elephant "http://www.creativereview.co.uk/cr-blog/2009/september/a-magazine-called-elephant")
author: McKonkie

comments.content: sorry i'm not after the 3-D typeface... the large black font used throughout the spreads.
Ooops, just read through the linked post properly. Sorry.

And the beautiful Antiqua used here ... ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121116071345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/160163_elephant_trafficlights_0_5588.jpg)

Hi Roman,  
please start a new thread. Thank you.  
(And that sample is too small for me)  
F

Sorry to reopen an old thread, but I have the same question as McKonkie...

While the typeface used is Knockout, it seems to be a rounded version. Anyone know if this available somewhere?

If not, any suggestions for an another strong (rounded) condensed headline typeface?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121116071345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/farrow_3596.png)
